com.camerontec.catalys.util.marketdata

Interface IDepthUpdate

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FixMarketDataInstrument, StandardInstrument

    public interface IDepthUpdate
    Classes maintaining an internal depth can allow the depth to be updated externally using these methods.

    Depth is defined as market data aggregated by price - ie there is one entry per price level. So the side (buy or sell) plus the price is sufficient to uniquely define a particular depth entry.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Deletes all depth entries

    • Method Detail

      • addDepthEntry

        IDepthEntry addDepthEntry(boolean buy,
                          int price,
                          int qty,
                          IMarketDataItem[] values)
        Adds a new depth entry.

        If an entry at this price level already exists, the quantity specified is added to the quantity in the existing entry.

        Processing of the values array terminates once an entry with a 0 fieldID is encountered. This allows an array to be reused for passing in events.

        If one of the explicit fields, (ie buy, price or qty), also is specified in the values array, the values array entry is ignored - in other words the explicit field value takes precedence.

        Note that StandardUpdateEntry is an IMarketData, so that an array of StandardUpdateEntry's can be passed in as the values if you wish.

        Parameters:
        buy - True if this is a buy side entry.
        price - Price level of this entry.
        qty - Quantity of entry.
        values - Any additional information associated with this entry. May be null.
        Returns:
        The object used to store details on this depth entry.

      • changeDepth

        void changeDepth(IDetailEntry[] buyDepth,
                 IDetailEntry[] sellDepth,
                 gnu.trove.map.hash.TLongObjectHashMap<IDepthEntry> idMap)
        Replaces whole depth in a single call.

        Any previous depth information is discarded.

        The most competitive entry should be at index 0 in the array.

        Note that the data passed in is in the form of IDetailEntry's rather that IDepthEntry's. Note that IDepthEntry extends IDetailEntry and the extra information required by IDepthEntry is not required.

        Processing of the array will stop at the first entry with qty == 0. This means that the same fixed size array object can be reused for passing in data in successive calls, since only non empty entries in the array will be processed - extra entries will be ignored.

        Parameters:
        buyDepth - Buy side depth entries
        sellDepth - Sell side depth entries
        idMap - Used for mapping external ID's on the detail entries to the ID's used to reference the detail entries internally. May be null, in which case any ID's on the detail entries are ignored completely.

      • changeDepthEntry

        IDepthEntry changeDepthEntry(boolean buy,
                             int price,
                             int qty,
                             StandardUpdateEntry[] changes)
        The depth entry at this price level on the specified side (buy or sell) is modified to the specified quantity.

        If no such entry exists, one is created.

        Processing of the changes array terminates once an entry with a 0 fieldID is encountered. This allows an array to be reused for passing in events.

        If one of the explicit fields, (ie buy, price or qty), also is specified in the changes array, the changes array entry is ignored - in other words the explicit field value takes precedence.

        Parameters:
        buy - True if this is a buy side entry.
        price - Price level of this entry.
        qty - Quantity of entry.
        changes - Any additional information associated with this entry. May be null.
        Returns:
        The object used to store details on this depth entry.

      • deleteDepthEntry

        IDepthEntry deleteDepthEntry(boolean buy,
                             int price)
        The depth entry at this price level and side (buy or sell) is deleted.
        Parameters:
        buy - True if this is a buy side entry.
        price - Price level of this entry.
        Returns:
        The deleted entry.

      • deleteDepthEntries

        void deleteDepthEntries()
        Deletes all depth entries
